name: fs_patch
description:
Apply a patch to a file at the specified path.
This can be used to edit the file, without having to rewrite the whole file.

path.description: The path of the file to apply to

contents.description:
The patch to apply to the file

Here is an example of a patch block that can be applied to modify the file to request the user's name:
--- a/hello.py
+++ b/hello.py
@@ ... @@
 def hello():
-    print("Hello World")
+    name = input("What is your name? ")
+    print(f"Hello {name}")

name: insert_todo
description: Insert a TODO comment at a specific line in a file

path.description: The path of the file to modify

text.description: The TODO text (must be single line and contain TODO)

line.description: The line number where to insert the TODO
